Package ca.queensu.cs.cisc124.notes.basics.geometry

Class Point2

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.queensu.cs.cisc124.notes.basics.geometry.Point2
  • public class Point2
extends Object
    A Cartesian point in 2-dimensions having real coordinates.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Point2()
      Initializes the elements of this point to (0.0, 0.0).
      Point2​(double x, double y)
      Initializes the coordinates of this point to (x, y) where x and y are specified by the caller.
      Point2​(Point2 other)
      Initializes the coordinates of this point by copying the coordinates from other.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Point2 add​(Point2 p, Vector2 v)
      Returns a new point equal to p + v.
      Point2 add​(Vector2 v)
      Add a vector to this point changing the coordinates of this point.
      Point2 divide​(double s)
      Divide this point by a scalar value changing the coordinates of this point.
      static Point2 divide​(Point2 p, double s)
      Returns a new point equal to p / s.
      boolean equals​(Object obj)
      Compares this point to the specified object for equality.
      Vector2 from​(Point2 q)
      Returns the vector pointing from the specified point q to this point.
      static Point2 fromPolar​(double r, double radians)
      Returns a new point specified using polar coordinates.
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code for this point.
      Point2 multiply​(double s)
      Multiply this point by a scalar value changing the coordinates of this point.
      static Point2 multiply​(double s, Point2 p)
      Returns a new point equal to s * p.
      Point2 negate()
      Negate the coordinates of this point changing the coordinates of this point.
      static Point2 negate​(Point2 p)
      Returns a new point equal to -p.
      Point2 set​(double newX, double newY)
      Sets the x and y coordinate to the specified values.
      static Point2 subtract​(Point2 p, Vector2 v)
      Returns a new point equal to p - v.
      Point2 subtract​(Vector2 v)
      Subtract a vector from this point changing the coordinates of this point.
      Vector2 to​(Point2 q)
      Returns the vector pointing from this point to the specified point q.
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this point.
      double x()
      Returns the x coordinate.
      Point2 x​(double newX)
      Sets the x coordinate to the specified value.
      double y()
      Returns the y coordinate.
      Point2 y​(double newY)
      Sets the y coordinate to the specified value.

        y - the y value of this point

        Initializes the coordinates of this point by copying the coordinates from other.
        Parameters:
        other - the point to copy

    • Method Detail

      • fromPolar

        public static Point2 fromPolar​(double r,
                               double radians)
        Returns a new point specified using polar coordinates. The coordinates of the returned point are given by: x = r * Math.cos(radians);
        y = r * Math.sin(radians);
        Parameters:
        r - the radial coordinate of the point
        radians - the angular coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        a new point having coordinates described above

      • add

        public Point2 add​(Vector2 v)
        Add a vector to this point changing the coordinates of this point.

        Use this method when you want to write something like p = p + v where p is a point and v is a vector.

        Parameters:
        v - the vector to add
        Returns:
        a reference to this point

      • subtract

        public Point2 subtract​(Vector2 v)
        Subtract a vector from this point changing the coordinates of this point.

        Use this method when you want to write something like p = p - v where p is a point and v is a vector.

        Parameters:
        v - the vector to subtract
        Returns:
        a reference to this point

      • from

        public Vector2 from​(Point2 q)
        Returns the vector pointing from the specified point q to this point.

        p.from(q) is equal to the vector p - q.

        Parameters:
        q - a point
        Returns:
        the vector pointing from q to this point

      • to

        public Vector2 to​(Point2 q)
        Returns the vector pointing from this point to the specified point q.

        p.to(q) is equal to the vector q - p.

        Parameters:
        q - a point
        Returns:
        the vector pointing from this point to q

      • multiply

        public Point2 multiply​(double s)
        Multiply this point by a scalar value changing the coordinates of this point.

        Use this method when you want to write something like p = s * p where p is a point and s is a scalar.

        Parameters:
        s - the scalar value to multiply this point by
        Returns:
        a reference to this point

      • divide

        public Point2 divide​(double s)
        Divide this point by a scalar value changing the coordinates of this point.

        Use this method when you want to write something like p = p / s where p is a point and s is a scalar.

        Parameters:
        s - the scalar value to divide this point by
        Returns:
        a reference to this point
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if s == 0.0 is true

      • negate

        public Point2 negate()
        Negate the coordinates of this point changing the coordinates of this point.

        Use this method when you want to write something like p = -p where p is a point.

        Returns:
        a reference to this point

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Object obj)
        Compares this point to the specified object for equality. The result is true if and only if obj refers to a Point2 instance having coordinates equal to this point.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare
        Returns:
        true if this point and the other point have equal coordinates, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for this point.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        a hash code for this point

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this point. The string representation are the coordinates of the point separated by a comma and space all inside a pair of parentheses.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this point
